claim: Cell- and egg-based flu vaccines have the potential to develop mutations during production, which may reduce their effectiveness.
explanation: A table comparing seasonal influenza vaccine production platforms (egg-based, cell-based, recombinant) across production timeline, advantages, and disadvantages. Evidence: Egg-based vaccines list “Potential for egg-adapted changes” as a disadvantage; cell-based vaccines list “No egg-adapted changes” as an advantage, with no mention of cell-based mutations. does not support the claim because the table only notes egg-based vaccines can undergo egg-adapted changes and explicitly states cell-based vaccines have no egg-adapted changes, providing no evidence that cell-based production leads to mutations that reduce effectiveness. Note: Limited to information visible in the table; context beyond the displayed text is not available.
